title: Micheál Martin - Wikipedia
snippet: Martin was awarded "Politician of the Year" by the Journal for his performance and election result. He was elected again as Taoiseach in a 95–76 vote by the Dáil on 23 January 2025 following a coalition agreement between Fianna Fáil, Fine Gael and with the support of several independent TDs.

title: Fianna Fáil presidential election review could be ‘resignation territory’ for Micheál Martin
snippet: Taoiseach’s leadership comes under further pressure as Fianna Fáil TDs and senators demand to know when the party first heard about Jim Gavin's issue with a former tenant · Taoiseach Micheál Martin TD with Fianna Fáil's presidential candidate Jim Gavin speaking to the media at the National Ploughing Championships in Co Offaly in September. File picture: Dan Linehan · Mon, 15 Dec, 2025 - 01:00 ·

title: Taoiseach denies leadership in trouble as FF presidential election review to be finally shared
snippet: Tue, 16 Dec, 2025 - 09:44 · Louise ... Martin has confirmed that he has finally received the Fianna Fáil presidential election review and that it will be shared with the parliamentary party....

title: Micheál Martin confident he will remain as Fianna Fáil leader as he receives presidential report - Irish Mirror
snippet: 11:17, 16 Dec 2025 · View Image · Taoiseach Micheal Martin speaking to reporters before a Cabinet meeting at Government Buildings, Dublin. Photo by: Cillian Sherlock/PA Wire(Image: PA) Taoiseach Micheál Martin said he isn’t concerned his leadership is in trouble after receiving a review into his party’s failed presidential campaign.

title: FF presidential election review submitted to Micheál Martin for consideration
snippet: Martin championed Jim Gavin’s presidential run, which ended in the ex-Dublin football manager dramatically withdrawing from the race. 8.25am, 16 Dec 2025 · 450 · Share options · Copy link · Email · Facebook · X · MICHEÁL MARTIN HAS received a report on the review into his party’s presidential pick.
